refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: flip1 can be used to execute one or more commands on one or more remote system(s). Operation is controlled by means of one or more 'flip scripts', specified on the command line.
Each flip script is a text file with an extension of .flip that contains one or more definition directives, in the format:

listitem.para: The DNS hostname or IP address of a system upon which to execute commands. This entry may be specified multiple times.
A shell command string to execute. This entry may be specified multiple times.
Path to a DSA or RSA private key suitable for use with ssh1's -i option. If specified, this overrides ssh1's default identity.
If given multiple times, only the value used in the last instance will be used.
Username to use for ssh1. Default is to use the username for the user running flip1.

refsect1.para: When invoked, flip1 will read each flip script referenced, aggregating each keyword/value pair found into a single entity. Once all referenced scripts have been read, each command listed will be executed in turn on each hostname specified. The remote execution is done by means of ssh1.

refsect1.title: Reading Flip Scripts
refsect1.para: Flip scripts are read upon startup in the following order:
All files with a .flip extension found in the /etc/flipscript.d/ directory.
Files specified on the command line, in the order given. If a file argument does not have a leading /, then the script will be searched for relative to the /usr/lib/flipscripts/ directory.

listitem.para: Collate the specified flip script(s) as usual, then dump the aggregated script to STDOUT and exit.
Print the list of flip scripts found at /usr/lib/flipscripts and then exit.
